key_risks: High debt levels and financial restructuring
Exposure to volatile fuel prices and currency fluctuations
Intense competition from domestic and international airlines
Regulatory challenges and potential policy changes
controversies: Flight delays and cancellations during peak travel periods
Financial restructuring and debt exchange offers
environmental_issues: Commitment to net-zero carbon emissions by 2045, but reliance on fuel-efficient aircraft and sustainable aviation fuels is still in progress
social_issues: Customer service challenges during peak periods despite high satisfaction ratings
governance_issues: Financial restructuring and issuance of superpriority notes raising governance concerns

sources.title: Azul SA settles tax liabilities, to pay reduced debt
sources.snippet: Azul SA (B3:NYSE: AZUL 4, NYSE:AZUL), a leading Brazilian airline with annual revenues of $3.47 billion, announced today that it has entered into a settlement agreement with Brazil's National Treasury Attorney's Office and the Special Secretariat of the Federal Revenue.. The agreement, which complies with CVM Resolution No. 44/2021, pertains to the restructuring of the company's tax obligations.

sources.snippet: Pricing occurred on July 13, 2023, with settlement expected to occur on July 20, 2023. sources.title: ESG - Azul RI
sources.snippet: Azul adhered to the Business Pact for Integrity and Against Corruption, assuming the Empresa Limpa commitment as a guideline..
